citations.narrative:
- There was an excessive accumulation of feces in a pen containing 3 young lynx and one young bobcat. Much of the
feces had turned dry and white which is an indication that the fecal matter had been present for an extended time.
Accumulation of waste is a potential source of contamination to the enclosed animals. It is also an attractant to flies and
pests, and is a source of noxious odors. Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to
prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors.
Corrected at the time of inspection
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
- There was an excessive accumulation of feces in a pen containing 3 young lynx and one young bobcat. Much of the 
feces had turned dry and white which is an indication that the fecal matter had been present for an extended time. 
Accumulation of waste is a potential source of contamination to the enclosed animals. It is also an attractant to flies and 
pests, and is a source of noxious odors. Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to 
prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors. 
Corrected at the time of inspection 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
